panels.description: Total size (in bytes) of all file stores
panels.title: FS total space: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: Total number of unallocated bytes in all file stores
panels.title: FS total free space: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: Total number of bytes available to this Java virtual machine on all file stores. Depending on OS or process level restrictions, this might appear less than fs.total.free_in_bytes. This is the actual amount of free disk space the Elasticsearch node can utilise.
panels.title: FS total available space: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
File system information
Http current open: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
Http total opened: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
HTTP

panels.description: Recent CPU usage for the whole system, or -1 if not supported
panels.title: OS CPU percent: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: ($time_interval) load average on the system (field is not present if one-minute load average is not available)
panels.title: OS load average: interval ($time_interval) service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: Amount of free physical memory in bytes
panels.title: OS memory free: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
OS memory free percent: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: Amount of used physical memory in bytes
panels.title: OS memory used: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
OS memory used percent: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
Operating system stats

panels.description: CPU usage in percent, or -1 if not known at the time the stats are computed
panels.title: Process CPU percent: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: Size in bytes of virtual memory that is guaranteed to be available to the running process
panels.title: Process memory total virtual: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: Number of opened file descriptors associated with the current process, or -1 if not supported
panels.title: Process open file descriptors: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
Process statistics

panels.description: The total number of packets received in cluster communication.
panels.title: Transport rx count: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: The total size of data received in cluster communication.
panels.title: Transport rx size in bytes: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: Indicate in the transport channel to send and receive data is open.
panels.title: Transport server open: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: The total number of packets sent in cluster communication.
panels.title: Transport tx count: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: The total size of data sent in cluster communication.
panels.title: Transport tx size in bytes: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
Transport statistics about sent and received bytes in cluster communication

Thread pool analyze completed: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: The number of active threads in the get pool
panels.title: Thread pool get active: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)

panels.description: The number of completed threads in the get pool
panels.title: Thread pool get completed: service ($service_name) instance ($instance) task ($task_name)
